website_summaries.verdict: These premium pedals are some of the toughest available.
pros: Include an 8 hex pin system for superb traction
Lightweight and durable nylon composite pedals boast a wide platform
cons: Less durable than many comparable options

customer_reviews.title: Pedals broke off in the crank after three rides. Pay the extra money for Shimano pedals.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these pedals about five months ago for my electric bike. They were really grippy and I liked them enough to purchase a second pair. The second pair was put on my road bike for commuting. Last night I was riding back from a friends place and the pedal literally fell off when riding due to breakage. This is genuinely unsafe and I could have gotten hurt. I'm returning these and getting Shimano pedals instead.
customer_reviews.author: Hfzeus

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality control
customer_reviews.text: My son ordered new RaceFace Chester Pedals. We installed them on his brand new Trek bike, but after one brief ride down the block the right pedal started wobbling. Upon further inspection, we discovered that the crank threads had been stripped by the pedals. We looked more closely at the pedal itself and discovered that it had been poorly manufactured - off center hex key hole and undersized diameter post. We immediately took the bike back to the Trek store and they confirmed that the crack set was permanently damaged by the pedals and we had to replace the entire crank assembly. This repair cost $65.99. I sent several emails to RaceFace - and they simply ignored me.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Chance of counterfeit goods, beware.
customer_reviews.text: Nice pedals normally. I got a set on my other bike and they’ve held up well. However, I’m confident the ones I bought this time are counterfeit. The color is wrong and the seals began leaking on the first ride. Note he other review where they broke apart after a few rides, these seem extremely unsafe.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Spindle snapped when putting down high power
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy if you are a decent cyclist. If you are sprinting a lot on the spindle, and can put out significant watts, then over time apparently the spindle can break. The worst part is that it is most likely to happen when you are standing up and putting a lot of force on the pedal...the worst possible time for it to break. I didn't have a power meter with me at the time, but I would estimate I was doing 1100 watts on my gravel bike at the moment it broke. I'm switching to Shimano pedals. BTW, there is only a one year warranty, so I would have to pay to get this fixed...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and I am really happy with them I feel these pedals has a better ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to have the shimano Saint pedals, but replaced them by this Race face chester pedals, and I am really happy with them I feel these pedals has a better grip, and my shoes are always tied to the pedals. Also and very important is that hitting any rock or hard surface will be absorbed by the pedal and you will heard that but that hit will not be transferred to the bike. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Stiglich

customer_reviews.title: Fine for beginners
customer_reviews.text: After beating up the pedals that came with my Diamondback, I decided to pick up the chesters because many seem to swear by them. I was not a fan. First ride, I didn't notice much difference, but as soon as I tried to take a jump I've done many times before, my left foot slipped off. The rest of my ride I experienced much of the same. Even in normal pedaling, my feet continuously slipped off the pedals. Not sure who is using these and loves them, but they did not have the grip required (wearing FiveTen Freeriders) for an intermediate to advanced rider.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Two pairs of Chester happiness
customer_reviews.text: I have Chester pedals on two of my mountain bikes. They are lighter than the Saint pedals I have on a third bike. The only drawback with the Chesters are the pin length. They are too long. They grip really well, but my shins have paid the price. Fear not! I have since added 3mm locking washers - one on each of the outside and inside pins, and two on the end pins (24 total per side) - and the grip is just as sure-footed as before.
customer_reviews.author: geochemistry

customer_reviews.title: pedal axle broke :-(
customer_reviews.text: I've been mountain biking for many years, have tried a lot of pedals, and have hit a lot of rocks. The axle broke on these under uneventful circumstances. I don't even recall hitting a rock before I noticed my pedal wobbling. Luckily mine didn't break completely off or I would have been stranded.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Mahler

customer_reviews.title: Very well built, 8 pins are great and light.
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping.. Pedal is well built, its light despite being wide compare to what i have now.The color is on point and the 8 pins are really great, your shoe will stick into those pins like its glued.I highly recommend this product!.
customer_reviews.author: bhurns

customer_reviews.title: Great product and worth the few extra bucks
customer_reviews.text: going from the stock MTB pedals with plastic nubs to these gnarly pegs was an instead improvement in pedal feel and made an adventures rider like myself feel even more secured to the bike. The pedals were slightly wider then the stock pedals and the studs were about a 1/4" which make make it feel like my feet are glued to the pegs. that and stud design uses an allen key head which is less likely to strip out AND they are recessed into the peg, so you are not going to get rounded off by trail rocks or from normal wear and tear. I have been nothing but impressed by these chester pegs. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your feet on the pedals!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value, I'm now running these on multiple bike/trikes. Great foot retention with a wide platform. No issues with plastic acting like it'll break. Using them on electrified recumbent trike where if your foot hits the ground it'll go under the cross bar breaking leg bones and you can experience a stay in the hospital for a while as you hopefully heal. Always use something so your feet can't slide off the pedals on a recumbent trike. SPD pedals are another option, but then you need special shoes and I ride to get places, not training for a race.
customer_reviews.author: Scott McElhineyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Chesters are rad
customer_reviews.text: I threw these MTB pedals on my city bike and I’m stoked on them. Here are my thoughts after about a week of riding: Durability: These pedals seem really well made and the materials seem bombproof. Aesthetics: The slim profile is cool, they look appropriately aggressive and I really like the fact that, in black, they look unassuming. A casual passerby could mistake them for cheap plastic pedals. Functionality: The dimensions of the platforms are perfect and feel great underfoot. They are super grippy and almost feel like your feet are locked in. They’re also pretty light, weighing significantly less than the metal ones they replaced. All around, super fun to ride around on.
customer_reviews.author: Anton Fredrik

customer_reviews.title: These pedals are great, lots of traction at a great price
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are great, lots of traction at a great price. Also any color you'd like. Held up to plenty of rock strikes, still look good.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love these pedals! They're a great price and have held up really well. I've been on some really rough and muddy terrain and never felt my feet slipping at all. Definitely a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jenerator

customer_reviews.title: I'm pleased with my purchase so far.
customer_reviews.text: I got my new pedals last week and have already gone on several trips with them and was wearing some old hiking boots that had some worn down soles. These these things grip really well and not once did my feet slip off will riding up or down hills or traveling through mud. I'm a little heavy (214 lbs) and I was a little concerned that they may not hold my weight, so far, so good. I'm going to try some more difficult trails this weekend and see what happens. As it stands right now, these pedals would be great for commuters, short distance riders, and easy going trail riders.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Edgeworth

customer_reviews.title: Shin Destroyers
customer_reviews.text: First ride out on these puppies was amazing, after previously constantly slipping off my pedals while riding downhill at my local hill, these locked me down to my bike like no other. However, my second ride out I felt like I was a pro mountain biker and was sending hard. Too hard, I was slipping off the trail so I slammed on my brakes and ,my brakes in need of a tune, went down. The race face Chesters then dug and tore gouges in my shin like the glaciers creating the Grand Canyon. All in all, after you place this order. Which I recommend.. go buy some d*mn knee/shin guards. The end. Send it brothers and sisters.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: These hit the sweet spot for flat pedals
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, attractive and most of all - functional. I love these. They have remained smooth despite zero maintenance and varying New England conditions. No lost pins, no warping, no cracks or damage despite crack and damage prone riding trails around here. Where I ride your pedals are going to get abused and these have but still work great, still look great, and for the price if I have to replace them every couple of years there are no tears when I toss them in the recycle bin. Try that with your $100+ Saints, etc.
customer_reviews.author: N. DiNatale

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with these pedals, especially for the price. I've had some seriously hard impacts on some landings with them and they don't even skip a beat. Really strong design and the confidence when pairing them with a good flat shoe is unmatched (I wear five tens). I've never had the issue of a pedal meeting my shin, be mindful of foot placement and keep your skill level in check, you won't have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: AHans

customer_reviews.title: Very colorful
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pedal for the value. We have two sets. I have size ten 5-ten shoe. The platform is perfect size. Holds the foot well and secure. (I used to use Look pedals and cleats and SPD pedals.) For a commuter e bike these pedals are perfect. A great up-grade for any e-bike or any bike for that matter. Once the foot is placed there is seldom, if any, a time replacement is needed. In fact, I don’t think about my feet at all once on the road. Thank you and yes the orange bike is a Tinker.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Good weight/performance balance
customer_reviews.text: Not inexpensive but does the job once you first correctly plant your feet on these platform pedals. My feet didn't move even riding across rough potholes on city streets. Lighter than pricier alloy platform pedals and these do not scratch and scuff like my other metal pair on another bike. Gets the job done. About the right footprint too; not too large/wide for my small feet and with adequate surface area for pins to grip my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mtb4fun

customer_reviews.title: Grippy not dangerious.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many different pairs of pedals and these give the best all around grip without being dangerious. I wear Merrel Moabs when I ride and they stick like glue. Like them so much I added them to my wifes fsb as well. She loves them too.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: work great
customer_reviews.text: i have not had flat pedals on a bike for about 15 years. every bike i have had has had clips, but with the recent flat pedal movement and me getting back into mountain biking i thought i oculd get some flat pedals a try. these had a low price of entry and good reviews. i have been very happy. i have mostly been using them to bike around my property, 10 acres, in some crap shoes. no hard mountain biking, but through fields and over hills. my feet stay in place and it is nice to move if i want, but when i want my feet to stay they do.
customer_reviews.author: beef

customer_reviews.title: Crazy foot traction
customer_reviews.text: The spikes are intense! Crazy grip. I backed my out a full 3 turns on each. No stripped nut holders like others mentioned, but I'm a professional mechanic so maybe no user error on my end. I'd recommend adjusting the screws before the first ride. After that you're more likely to have damaged threads and stripped nut holders. FYSA these will scrape the crap out of your shins if they come in contact.
customer_reviews.author: JLo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pedals, Buy These And Forget the Expensive Platforms
customer_reviews.text: I've destroyed a lot of flat pedals in my last 5 years of mountain biking, including premium brands like Canfield Crampons and others. I would even spend cash and time to rebuild them, but its usually not worth it, bearings are not always cheap and it's a pain in the butt to do. You can easily spend 3x the price of these and get pedals that perform exactly the same and have the same durability. Buy 2 pair, different colors, and mix them up on your bike for flair, and don't look back because you'll be burning your buddies off with these sweet platforms. :)
customer_reviews.author: Will Niccolls

customer_reviews.title: Sweet
customer_reviews.text: These pedals are beast. I changed from my stock pedals & wow what a difference! So much more grip! Very simple to install. Near the threads of the pedal there is a small L or an R to tell you which side it belongs on. Make sure you tighten them the right way because each side spins differently. They feel really heavy duty. I find the red color to be darker in person which actually benefits my dark red bike.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Stickiest pedals I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a pair of lightweight, flat, inexpensive, but high quality nylon pedals to use for rock-bashing and I know to look no further than good ol' RaceFace. I've owned many of their components (stems, bars, chain rings, etc) and i swear by them. Slapped these bad boys on me bike and hit the trail. Coupled with a pair of Five Tens, I found myself stuck to the pedals, so much so that it was actually a bit of work to change foot position at times, mid-ride. THAT is sticky! In fact, I've never ridden a stickier pedal. You won't lose grip with these and you can bash rocks to your heart's delight as they hold up quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Dickman

customer_reviews.title: Great Peddles
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used flat peddles since I was a kid. My thought was to put these on my fat bike so I can wear warm boots come snow time (clipless get full of snow and hard to use). I took the fat bike for a ride with these peddles (no snow yet). They were fine. I need to re-train myself to get used to them though. They gripped well with my snow boots and they look great.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Well made for the price
customer_reviews.text: After 20 years riding clipless pedals I wanted to give platform pedals a try on my new Roscoe trail bike. After 50 miles of rocky trail I'm very pleased with the Chester pedals. They are just wide enough to give me plenty of support without being too big to get in the way or take extra hits in the rocks. I have yet to slip off the pedals which was a big concern coming from clipless pedals. They seem to be built well, light weight and grip perfectly. All reviews I have read say they can take rock hits without falling apart so we will see. For the price they are fantastic and glad I gave them a try.
customer_reviews.author: oldmandrummer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome composite pedals that punch above their weight!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome value for the money. The composite is super tough and lightweight - and also offer just a touch of flex feel on bigger hits. I wear size 12 shoes and the platform felt like a great size. The spindles also rotate with a nice firmness. I bought the as a fast replacement for a set of Deity pedals that I destroyed and have loved them since.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Quality Pedals
customer_reviews.text: Great pedals for flat MTB shoes! Very stable and grippy! The color Orange is very faded though unlike the photos they advertise them in. I also experienced the axle is pushing grease out so I expect the one pedal to fail soon. These are serviceable so we will have to see if I can discover the issue. I’ve had multiple ones of these and this is the first time I’ve had an issue so I still love them and am treating this as a one off. Best pedal at this price point. Just don’t expect the color to be the same as pictured unless you get black or red.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Orange or peach? Disappointed by the color
customer_reviews.text: Functionally perfect. Night and day difference from factory pedals. Riding a giant talon 3 gray and orange, I was hoping the pedals would match but the look faded to a peach hue. The left hand threads were a little chewed, possibly a used product? A little nursing got the pedals installed pretty easily
customer_reviews.author: C Ross

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pedals.
customer_reviews.text: The transfer of energy from leg to pedal approaches 100% thanks to the little spikes protruding from the pedal surface. In all kinds of weather my feet stay as firmly rooted to the pedals as if I were wearning clips. It's the most secure I've felt since I've taken up riding that I will not slip off these pedals. No way, no how.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: It feels like my riding performance has increased a little more due ...
customer_reviews.text: ...my flipping shoes are now glued to these bad-boys. It feels like my riding performance has increased a little more due to peddle traction alone.
customer_reviews.author: FrankD

customer_reviews.title: Quality construction
customer_reviews.text: These flat pedals are some of the best I have used. The metal numbs are completely adjustable in height, and you may not need to adjust them down for mountain biking. They look high but is necessary for single track riding. The pedals spin well and the rollers are smooth. TIP: do not be tempted, like I was, to buy the look a like knock offs that are half the price. Those did not spin smoothly. I had to return those and buy these.
customer_reviews.author: jmumv

customer_reviews.title: Hardcore grip
customer_reviews.text: Sweet pedals, a bit too aggressive on the grip. I use them for commuting, which I know is not the intended purpose, and they leave some marks on the soles of my shoes. Not a big deal, but I worry that they might damage my shoes in the long run. Again, this is not the fault of the pedals. Other than that, I am very happy with the pedals, and it really does feel like they are stuck to my shoes with glue. 5 stars because they work as advertised. Edit++ I was able to adjust the length of the screws and that has made it less abrasive to my shoes. Super happy with these pedals.
customer_reviews.author: humblebumble

customer_reviews.title: KevCentral suggested, Meon approved
customer_reviews.text: A tuber regularly suggests these pedals so I took the bait and replaced the stock pedals from my Cannondale Trail 4. No slips after putting approximately 30 miles on these pedals in rocky, muddy western pa trails. I'm a bigger guy and needed a wide platform that would hold up. So far so good. I've bashed rocks and stumps without damaging the nylon body. Great in dry or wet conditions. If my opinion changes, I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Meon

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars! Love these purple, flat, Chester pedals
customer_reviews.text: Pedals were easy to install. I have been using them for months for MTB and roadbiking. Nice grip and lightweight. I've banged them multiple times on rocks while MTB and they have gotten scuffed up (as expected), but the pegs haven't sheared off hardly at all. They are still going strong! Very satisfied with these pedals!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Pedal Fell Apart Within a Few Months
customer_reviews.text: The pedals are lightweight and give you great traction, whenever they are working correctly. The pedal ended up stripping the crank within a few months, leaving me pedal-less. I think it's important to note that my bike has carefully gone through regular maintenance by my local bike shop. My pedals may have been a bad product. Aside from the stripping, the pedals squeaked even after maintenance to prevent it.
customer_reviews.author: Alec Macchione

customer_reviews.title: Good price but one of many options.  Great for budget build.
customer_reviews.text: These are solid and reliable. Haven't had composite pedals before and these would work great on any bike where you need a simple platform pedal at a reasonable price. Didn't like the color as much as I thought. That's no fault of the product though. Solid pedals but they will mar if you scrape them against rocks or anything else. Price point is definitely a plus but I've since moved on to metal VP Component pedals and am happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Cut and Chew TV

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal grip
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for trail riding and fell in love with them immediately, as did my wife (who also got a pair). The pins are just perfect, in terms of placement, durability, and grip. They can definitely bite your shins with those big teeth, but they keep my feet from slipping in the first place and at quest it's nothing a set of shin guards can't handle. And obviously, they are gorgeous.
customer_reviews.author: C&D

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from stock pedals.
customer_reviews.text: This pedals are definitely better than the pedals that my Trek Marlin 6 came with. It improved the grip of my shoes to the pedals specialy when going through rough and bumpy terrain. The pedals have withheld the impacts and use but in my case are stained. By the way your shins will noticed that you changed pedals, the pedals have pins or I should say screws that hold your feet in place. Recommendation: for me it worked better to have hard sole shoes while riding, if the sole of your shoe is too soft the pins will damage it big time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Race Face Chester Pedal: a nice pedal for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've only owned these a short time, but I am pleased with the design. They are nice and wide and accommodate my big feet well. The have excellent grip. The construction seems quite sturdy, and the bearings run smoothly. The price is good for a pedal of this type, and I won't feel too bad if I destroy them through abuse. Overall, I am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R.H.

customer_reviews.title: Top class flat pedals
customer_reviews.text: Had these for about 3 months now and they're great. Rust is beginning to form on the bolts that dig into you shoes. But it doesnt affect the pedals by any means. WATCH YOUR SHINS. These things seriously hurt, like, lying on the ground hurt. But after you've made a few miss steps you tend to be more aware of the power these things hold.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good pedals
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been riding these for a little over a month now and just ordered a second pair (in black) to put on my new Framed Beartrax. All-in-all I’m really happy with these pedals and can’t recommend them enough. Go get yourself a pair (or two) today! Pros: *Durable *Good grip *Large platform *Double-sided *Easy to clean Cons: *Heavier than some other options in this price range
customer_reviews.author: Brandon & Cacia

customer_reviews.title: Bent spindles really common
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 3 pairs of these pedals and 2 of them have had bent spindles. I didn't really notice until my LBS pointed it out to me, but it's really pronounced - rocks back and forth while pedaling. My LBS pointed me toward some competitor's pedals and I immediately noticed a difference in stability of the pedal.
customer_reviews.author: thecellofellow

customer_reviews.title: Best pedal in best coral color
customer_reviews.text: Slim, sticky, sturdy, inexpensive. Probably the best pedal out there? Mine seeped black grease for the first couple rides, I thought I stepped into something. The best part (for me) about the orange color is that it's actually almost coral, which is perfect for me. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: e-i-s

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grip pedals on mountain bike
customer_reviews.text: Great pedals, I have no issues, I love them on my mountain bike as I do not want clip ons. They look good. I've had them on for about a year now. The small metal prongs that screw on to the metal pedals have great grip on my normal tennis shoes. Just FYI, if that pedal was to hit your shin, it will definitely hurt and probably cut your skin. Has not happened to me but wanted to mention that. I will more than likely purchase them again once I need a new set.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Sweet baby jesus.
customer_reviews.text: Prepare to have your feet glued to the pedals! You don't slip on these one bit, the screws on the pedals are adjustable, and dig into your shoe without doing much damage. If you want more traction than these you’re going to have to go clipless.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny Lord

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Be away there are many sharp edges to grab your legs. They are not on my bike anymore. Cheap finish, and the adjustment is on the wrong side. I thought the screws should be flipped around. I was easier to just take them off my bike, and throw them out.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory D Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love these peddles! Used them all last summer and they didn’t disappoint. I needed something to keep my feet from slipping off while I ride and I can say my feet never slipped off. They do dig into my shoes a bit and tear the bottoms but not so bad that it destroys my shoes. I would buy again if needed!
customer_reviews.author: Marlene  G.

customer_reviews.title: These pedals are a staple for my bikes now.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 sets of these for 3 different bikes, because they're light weight, last forever, and have more grip than any pedal I've tried. They seem expensive, but you really do get what you pay for with these, and they're way cheaper than RaceFace's metal version. I've been a fan of RaceFace products since 2003, and this product lives up to their reputation for quality.
customer_reviews.author: Roy S Judy

customer_reviews.title: Great pedal
customer_reviews.text: I think the Race Face Chester is the best value of any pedal. I have these on all my bikes and they hold up to plenty of abuse. From in-climate weather year round (snow, rain, mud, dust), plenty of pedal strikes on rocks, etc. I have not had one fail yet. I wear Five Tens and have great grip on these pedals.
customer_reviews.author: zinalia martel

customer_reviews.title: Super good pedals
customer_reviews.text: I did a 20 mile technical event on my mountain bike which had heavy rock garden climbs and descents, river crossings, leaves and tree roots - and it had rained heavily the night before. Swapped out my SPD for these. They were brilliant at keeping my feet planted while doing all I had to and when the inevitable slip happened, was easy to get foot to ground. Saved me and my bike many many times. They also took quite a few knocks and no damage at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lozza on an XCal

customer_reviews.title: Great value pedals
customer_reviews.text: I've always used stock pedals on bikes before as a very casual, very recreational rider. Since I started riding more frequently and going on rougher trails, I've researched bike upgrades, and these pedals were my favorite ones. They've dramatically improved the quality of the bike ride and I'd whole heartedly recommend them for the money. They look great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nader

customer_reviews.title: Repeat buyer Great pedals
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of Chester petals I have purchased. Avid mountain biker three days a week. They are priced better than comparative pedals and are built well and really hold up. The only trade-off is that if you crash they will destroy your shins, so stay on your bike!
customer_reviews.author: EngineerJon

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and sticky.
customer_reviews.text: First conventional pedal in 10 years. Started riding with my young boys a lot (COVID 19) and the spd’s had to come off. I like these pedals, smooth and sticky, got the purple on sale for as much as the replica I was looking at. After removing the clippless, good clean up with contact spray. 6mm Allen wrench to install with grease. Done.
customer_reviews.author: EzK

customer_reviews.title: Buy these and be happy.
customer_reviews.text: Let’s be honest with ourselves: we want functional MTB pedals, but looking cool is definitely a big factor. These things look awesome to make your bike pop with color, but just so happen to be awesome pedals as well. With the right shoes these things glue to your feet. Can’t do better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ohsnapasaurusrex

customer_reviews.title: Got used ones on the first order, let's see how the exchange goes
customer_reviews.text: Received some obviously used ones. Returning and trying again, they seem nice though
customer_reviews.author: Craig89gt

customer_reviews.title: Grippy, large, and in charge.
customer_reviews.text: I use these on my commuter and they're amazing. Super smooth, large area, and they bite into your shoes really well. Maybe they bite too well. I tend to get rubber-soled shoes stuck on the pedals a little which is generally fine but I do worry sometimes that I'm ruining my shoes. But hey, it can't be much different than walking, right? They really are awesome. I need to get some for my mountain bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Massive amount of bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for the money. You can spend more on lighter and or metal pedals but these do the trick and come in many dope colors at a fraction of the price of other flats. I paid less than $40! Cromag Daggar pedals are like $180. These will keep your feet where they should be. Don’t hesitate, get on these.
customer_reviews.author: J. to the S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent excellent excellent
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I don't think you can beat these in all my research. I am sure that there are better pedals out there, but for me I would have to spend more than I would want to for my level of biking. Night and day difference between these and my stock pedals.
customer_reviews.author: D. Perryman

customer_reviews.title: Defective hex on right but they still work.
customer_reviews.text: Just put them on so this may not be fair review, but just wanted to note the my right peddle hex bolt was deformed and did not allow the hex wrench to insert completely causing it to strip. Was able to tighten it OK with a 5.5. But disappointing non the less. They feel nice on the buck hand have lots of grip. I’m surprised they were heavier they my stock trek bike peddles and are not as free spinning but can not really tell on the the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Someonewhoknowsnothing

customer_reviews.title: Everything it says it is
customer_reviews.text: As someone who is terrified of clipping in on a mountain bike, these really give me the grip I was looking for. They bite into your shoes, but they will tear up the soles, so keep that in mind. I have read reviews that said they would tear up your shins if they came in contact, but I haven't run into that problem yet. They do what they say (give your feet grip on your pedals), are easy to install and they look great.
customer_reviews.author: Terrance D Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Light and strong with tons of grip
customer_reviews.text: Just what the doctor ordered. Super grippy. Lightweight and strong. Matches my bike perfectly. Thinner profile and narrower to get through the narrow rock gaps on my regular trail. .41 of a pound lighter than my Shimano Saint pedals.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: You cannot go wrong with these pedals. Tough as hell, I have smashed them against countless stumps and rocks. They also make pedal strikes less jarring because the plastic absorbs the blow. They are sticky sharp as well so your feet stay put, I have countless scars on my calves and shins to prove it.
customer_reviews.author: Patti B

customer_reviews.title: Cracked on after a pedal strike
customer_reviews.text: So I loved these for 7 or 8 Trail rides. Super grippy and light. RaceFace would not replace after sending it to them. They said I hit a rock which apparently they aren't designed to do. I bought a pair of OneUp Composites and they seem to be holding up much better even with more abuse. I wouldn't buy the Chesters again except for urban riding. They have had their day.
customer_reviews.author: AnnS

customer_reviews.title: Right for the price
customer_reviews.text: First time using a composite pedal. I wanted to try riding platforms on a new bike with some 5.10's, and I love the combo! pretty durable on some bonks with rocks, but only a 4/5 because some of the threads have stripped while trying to adjust the spikes in the pedals. For the cost, these things are light, spin well, and fairly durable.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Stallings

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pedals for mtn biking!
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 sets of these pedals and they are the bomb. I have 2 boys that are on the high school mtn bike team and these pedals have taken a beating, they are scratched and dinged, but the pins are still in there tight and they look and work good. My boys where FiveTens and the grip between the shoe and pedals is secure with no slipping. I highly recommend them for the price! Not only do they function well, but they look great too!
customer_reviews.author: T-Sizzle

customer_reviews.title: Race Face Chester Pedals 100% A+++
customer_reviews.text: Wow these pedaled are Super Great. All this time I have used high end Aluminum flat pedals for years. So when I road a rocky downhill mountain these Nylon pedals went right over a big rock and I did not go OTB. Plus the Pins did not get damaged at all. These pedals still look brand new after 4 months of riding through Snow, Rocks and Mountains. Race Face Chester Pedals 100% A+++
customer_reviews.author: Mtech46

customer_reviews.title: Not affected by the ruthless Rocks of Southern Utah
customer_reviews.text: Durability: After bashing these pedals into the rocks of Southern Utah for a month (3 rides per week), I’m pleased to report that though battered and bruised, these pedals are not beaten... not even close. I’ve expected a few times to look down at a broken pedal but it hasn’t happened. Grip: it is so good that I have a hard time adjusting my foot once I start riding if I place it wrong haha. the pins can be removed and replaced with an Allen key, and now I’m expecting The pedal to outlast the pins.
customer_reviews.author: Tarzan

customer_reviews.title: Nice large platform, grippy pedal
customer_reviews.text: I'm riding these with specialized 2fo shoes, really work well. Plenty of support for my big feet. I've been using azonic 420 pedals when I want to ride flats, platform was too small for my foot, and they weren't grippy enough. Not a problem with these pedals! I got a chance to test them on another bike and really liked them. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: austin ritz

customer_reviews.title: The Best flat mountain bike pedals
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite flat pedals. They look nice and sleek. They are high quality materials. I’ve owned several pairs and they hold up well. They come in a variety of colors which is a nice bonus. I don’t like all the goofy looking styles and colors out there. These are just clean and nice.
customer_reviews.author: tmoney15

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with RaceFace
customer_reviews.text: Great pedals for mountain biking. Paired with 510s, these will keep you super planted on your pedals and allow you to ride with confidence. I can't say they're the lightest, but who cares. They have taken a beating in my rides, but both the pedals and the pins have held up beautifully! If you ride flats on your mtb, you need these!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Good price replacements
customer_reviews.text: These pedals were a great upgrade from my stock ones. Very lightweight, lots of grip, and a great price. Colors are sort of an odd variation. Red ones look more burgundy, and green ones are pretty spot on. Lighter colors stain somewhat. Have to put in some scrubbing for them to come clean but cmon they are just pedals. Otherwise great bang for buck on replacement pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Everyday Stuff Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic!! I ride 4 times a week mtb in WA State. SUPER HAPPY with these pedals. I have 5 ten shoes and the grip is amazing. I take a lot of falls and zero issues. i have a hardtail for now and will buy new pedals when I buy a full suspension this fall. These pedals are a must have addition to your MTB.
customer_reviews.author: VVV

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty awesome for a plastic pedal. Rigid and relatively lightweight. However, between the pair, there were a handful of pegs where the embedded retention nut would spin freely when attempting to adjust the height of the pegs. I was barely able to use a set of pliers to grip enough of the exposed nut in order to make the desired adjustment. Not ideal. Would've otherwise been 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jerome

customer_reviews.title: I like them
customer_reviews.text: I like them. They grip my fiveten’s nicely. Haven’t slipped a pedal yet this season. The platform is large enough without being bulky and ridiculous. They’re holding up very well also. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: ATreat

customer_reviews.title: My first set of stamp pedals. I prefer the all metal ones.
customer_reviews.text: Added this on my trail bike. I think it’s little too light in my opinion. Maybe I’m used to riding the heftier metal heavy duty ones. I notice the pins was on the longer side, so I shorten them by unloosening them. I’ll continue to use them but I’ll switch back to all metal ones next time. I probably need to ride more and get used to them.
customer_reviews.author: Gcode

customer_reviews.title: My favorite MTB pedals
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty of solid imitation brands (Fooker, Imrider...) and they are decent in their own right. Are these worth the extra $30? Yes, yes they are. Pair them with some 5.10s and you have a very solid base for steep climbs or landing jumps.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Loya

customer_reviews.title: Don’t spin easily
customer_reviews.text: Seemed well made, sharp studs. They didn’t spin freely though on either side. Does have rubber oring on sides but there was a lot of resistance. Ended up switching for another set of pedals
customer_reviews.author: Mumbles

customer_reviews.title: The only pedal worth riding!
customer_reviews.text: These are rock solid lightweight pedals! They are super strong and have stood up to countless pedal strikes on my technical rocky trails! The best part is that they use a socket head cap screw as opposed to a set screw, so the part that wears down is the end of the thread and not the head where the hex wrench goes. This makes them easy to replace the grip screws. Also they stay black even after getting scratched unlike aluminum pedals which will show silver under the scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great pedals
customer_reviews.text: These flats are really great. The adjustable pins are really nice and provide ton of grip. If I have one complaint, it would be about the amount of grip--it's almost too much unless the are screwed in almost all the way. I'd definitely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Colin W. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an everyday commuter SS
customer_reviews.text: Put these on my new single speed college campus commuter. Didn't want clips because I have to walk around all day, didn't really want straps because I don't feel comfortable quickly taking my feet in and out of the straps (I'm also not riding fixed so I don't need to back pedal). I've used these pedals for about 2 months now, wearing vans, converse, tennis shoes, and boots. My only complaint is that they sometimes do such a good job of sticking to my shoes that I can't easily adjust my feet while riding! We'll see how they wear over time but so far it's been great.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Installed on my mongoose malus, what a difference!
customer_reviews.text: My shoes do not slip with the screws in the peddles. They took ten minutes to install and instantly my shoes did not slip they gripped awesome. Just be mindful of directional threads on pedals and to not accidentally catch the back of your leg on them because they are very aggressive.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Surrell

customer_reviews.title: Fine pedals for the price but poorly assembled.
customer_reviews.text: I have experience with two sets of the RaceFace Chester and three of the four pedals did not spin freely and were oozing a little grease, only one appeared to be assembled correctly and spins nicely. I think this is very common based on sifting through other's reviews. If I hadn't ordered the second set I would have thought their poor spin was normal.
customer_reviews.author: Steele Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Very good pedals.
customer_reviews.text: Decided to test Race Face Chester after good experience with Crank Brothers Stamp resin pedals. These are very similar in performance and size. Shape is very attractive and they stay in place even in rough terrain. SPD or alloy pedals no more.
customer_reviews.author: Rivadeneira Luis

customer_reviews.title: Good budget pedals
customer_reviews.text: I've taken them for a few rides, and they're super grippy compared to the stock pedals that came with my bike. They are mostly nylon though, so understand what you're buying. They're going to get beat up and won't stay vibrant forever, but at $40 they seem pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Williams

customer_reviews.title: Damaged threads ruined my cranks
customer_reviews.text: 10 minutes into my first ride on these, the right pedal unthreaded itself nearly completely off. End result was that it damaged my $500 cranks. Stripped the threads so bad that I can't use the right side anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazawn

customer_reviews.title: Super Grip.  Easy Installation.  Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Chester Raceface nylon composite pedals (red) for my MTB after many years of having a cheap walmart metal-plastic set. One thing is for sure, I am never going back. These Raceface pedals are life changing! I love those little threaded metallic pins protruding out of the pedal. The pedal grip is like no other I've experienced, and it is the best I've had. The only draw back is that these metallic pins will tear into your ankles or chins if you are not careful. My best decision was buying these. I would buy them again if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M. Trahan

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding, so far!
customer_reviews.text: These look great and are serviceable too. Rock Bros look good but these work much better. Hope they last a lot longer then the rb's I've had. Seem to be really well made and light too.
customer_reviews.author: chrissie

customer_reviews.title: Flat Out Good
customer_reviews.text: Been riding "clipless" or traditional toe clips for 30+ years. Occasionally I rode flats and just didn't like them any more. At least until I took a gamble on these. I didn't want to carry and extra pair of shoes when I was just commuting so I reluctantly thought I'd try flats again. These exceeded expectations out of the box. Great grippy surface, they make you feel like you're riding clipless. The extra surface feels great on your foot too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, durable, value for the $$
customer_reviews.text: THE RACE FACE CHESTER PEDAL is a lightweight, durable pedal. If you have large feet/shoes, the pedal gives ample support in its length and width. I do bike riding on roads with hills in my neighborhood. The studs keep my feet from slipping.
customer_reviews.author: richard j fung

customer_reviews.title: Solid Support.  Great on e-bike.
customer_reviews.text: These are so much better than the pedals I'm replacing, I was shocked at the difference. I'm riding with light Asolo hikers. I bought these to replace the stock pedals on my e-bike. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ThroughTheLookingGlass

customer_reviews.title: Really great pedal.  Could be a touch wider.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pedal. I have been swearing by composite pedals for a few years now as they are cheaper, lighter, and show less wear than comparable metal pedals. The Chester looks great and has shown to be excellent quality. It feels super solid under foot. Action is smooth and grip is fantastic. I ride in a stiff skate shoe and my feet stay put. I have had several pedal strikes and they have only suffered a few light scratches. My only complaint is I wish they were just a touch wider. I typically wear a 9.5D. If I am not conscious about my foot placement I often find my pinky toe hanging off the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L.

customer_reviews.title: Need better QC
customer_reviews.text: Nice concept and they are light and look great but on the first ride grease started oozing out. I pulled them off and ordered a set from Crank Brothers. Hope they’re better.
customer_reviews.author: Primelover

customer_reviews.title: Broke on the first ride!
customer_reviews.text: The pedal got completely bent on literally the first ride I went on. I only weigh about 135lbs, and landed a jump and instantly the pedal was ruined. Poor quality, doesn’t last. Hoping to get a response from the seller soon to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Allgaier

customer_reviews.title: Good Affordable Flat Pedals
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to try flat pedals again after years of riding clipless. These are very good basic flat pedals. I have enjoyed riding with them while I try and dial in my skills. I am sure there are many better pedals but these do the job and were affordable. I am not permanently giving up clipless but these are fun
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Put these on all my MTBs.
customer_reviews.text: They're cheap, light weight, durable, and grippy. I put them on all on my mountain bikes. After many pedal strikes and wipeouts they're still in excellent shape. Buy these instead of Fooker pedals - Raceface spent the time and money to design these and Fooker just ripped off the design.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Schuldt

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, can’t be beat
customer_reviews.text: Great pedals. Looks can be deceiving and some people will diss these for not being lite as a mother but they are solid. I can se me using these for like 5-6 years before needing to replace them. The bearings inside of the pedal are a bit tight though. The pedal dosnt t rotate flat like some pedals do when you spin the crank making it a little hard to catch if you are first jumping in your bike, but seriously for like 32$ on Amazon’s hey are a steal. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: carson

customer_reviews.title: Lacks grip with standard running shoes
customer_reviews.text: My feet hop off these quite a bit more than traditional standard run of the mill pedals. I've always worn basic running shoes so there could be something to that, but i'm rather displeased with the grip for my feet. I feel like i'm constantly trying to grind my feet around to get them to catch and hold. I was also never a fan of how expensive they are.
customer_reviews.author: Malinda

product_meta.title: RaceFace Chester Mountain Bike Pedal
product_meta.description:
Embracing the same large platform and 8 hex pin system for stellar grip and traction, the new Chester pedal from RaceFace is every bit as tough as their alloy cousin - only this time, constructed with a nylon composite body to shave off the grams. The Chester's bearing and bushing system is fully serviceable and the cro-mo axle is fully sealed, for a highly durable and lightweight pedal that offers great performance at an incredible value.Features: Fully serviceable bearing & bushing system 8 hex traction pins per side Lightweight nylon composite body Fully sealed cro-mo axle Large platform with same grip as traditional alloy pedals




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :6 x 10 x 2 inches; 14.11 Ounces
 * Item model number :PD16CHEGRN
 * Department :Unisex-adult
 * Date First Available :November 25, 2015
 * Manufacturer :RaceFace
 * ASIN :B018J1IZ8K

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #2,356 in Sports & Outdoors (See Top 100 in Sports & Outdoors)  *  #2 inBike Pedals 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.7 out of 5 stars2,395 ratings Embracing the same large platform and 8 hex pin system for stellar grip and traction, the new Chester pedal from RaceFace is every bit as tough as their alloy cousin - only this time, constructed with a nylon composite body to shave off the grams. The Chester's bearing and bushing system is fully serviceable and the cro-mo axle is fully sealed, for a highly durable and lightweight pedal that offers great performance at an incredible value.Features: Fully serviceable bearing & bushing system 8 hex traction pins per side Lightweight nylon composite body Fully sealed cro-mo axle Large platform with same grip as traditional alloy pedals
feature_bullets: Race Face Chester Pedal Green, One Size OPEN BOX
